ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Survey completion as number of days from randomization date
Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Assessment started at time point
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Pain severity score (11-item modified version of BPI-SF)
Notes: Scored as mean of the 11 BPI-SF items (4 pain intensity and 7 interference); blank if any of the 4 pain intensity questions are missing or more than 3 of 7 pain interference questions are missing

ElementDescription: Pain intensity subscale score (4 items; modified BPI-SF)
Notes: Scored as mean of 4 items; blank if any item is missing

ElementDescription: Pain-related interference subscale score (7 items; modified BPI-SF)
Notes: Scored as mean of 7 items; blank if more than 3 item responses are missing

ElementDescription: Percent change in pain severity score (11-item; modified version of BPI-SF) from baseline to follow-up time point
Percent change in pain intensity subscale score (4 items; modified BPI-SF) from baseline to follow-up time point
Percent change in pain-related interference subscale score (7 items; modified BPI-SF) from baseline to follow-up time point
Minimal clinically important difference (MCID) in pain severity from baseline to follow-up time point (30% decrease or more in score)
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Minimal clinically important difference (MCID) in pain intensity from baseline to follow-up time point (30% decrease or more in score)
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Minimal clinically important difference (MCID) in pain-related interference from baseline to follow-up time point (30% decrease or more in score)
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: SDOH - Housing Instability
Notes: 0 = No (both housing instability items are ''No'' and lived less than 3 places in the past 12 months); 1 = Yes (either of the housing instability items are ''Yes'' or lived 3 or more places in the past 12 months); blank otherwise

ElementDescription: SDOH - Food Insecurity
Notes: 0 = No (both of the food insecurity items are ''Never true''); 1 = Yes (either of the two food insecurity items are ''Sometimes true'' or ''Often true''); blank otherwise

ElementDescription: SDOH - Financial Resource Strain
Notes: 0 = No (the financial strain item is ''Not hard at all'' or ''Not very hard''); 1 = Yes (the financial strain item is ''Somewhat hard'' or ''Hard'' or ''Very Hard''); blank otherwise

ElementDescription: SDOH - Transportation/Access Need
Notes: 0 = No (both transportation need items are ''No''); 1 = Yes (either transportation need item is ''Yes''); blank otherwise

ElementDescription: Negative Social Determinant of Health (SDOH). Need endorsed in at least 1 of the following domains: Financial Resource Strain, Food Insecurity, Transportation/Access Needs, Housing Instability.
Notes: 0 = No SDOH need (no housing, food insecurity, financial strain or transportation needs); 1 = Negative SDOH/existing need (any of the housing, food insecurity, financial strain or transportation item needs is ''Yes''); blank otherwise

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, It's awful and I feel that it overwhelms me.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I feel I can't stand it anymore.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I am in pain, I become afraid that the pain will get worse.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I keep thinking about how much it hurts.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I keep thinking about how badly I want the pain to stop.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I wonder whether something serious may happen.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: Score on Self-Efficacy for Pain Management (PSE) scale (5-item)
Notes: Scored as mean of 5 items; blank if more than 1 item response is missing

ElementDescription: I have trouble doing all of my regular leisure activities with others
Notes: 1=Always; 2=Usually; 3=Sometimes; 4=Rarely; 5=Never

ElementDescription: I have trouble doing all of the family activities that I want to do
Notes: 1=Always; 2=Usually; 3=Sometimes; 4=Rarely; 5=Never

ElementDescription: I have trouble doing all of my usual work (include work at home)
Notes: 1=Always; 2=Usually; 3=Sometimes; 4=Rarely; 5=Never

ElementDescription: I have trouble doing all of the activities with friends that I want to do
Notes: 1=Always; 2=Usually; 3=Sometimes; 4=Rarely; 5=Never

ElementDescription: PROMIS Ability to Participate in Social Roles and Activities - Short Form 4a (Social Role Functioning) raw score
Notes: Scored as sum of 4 items; blank if any items are missing

ElementDescription: PROMIS Ability to Participate in Social Roles and Activities - Short Form 4a (Social Role Functioning) T-score
Notes: T-score based on raw score and published conversion table. The T-score rescales the raw score into a standardized T-score with a mean of 50 and a standard deviation of 10

ElementDescription: PROMIS - Physical Functioning (6-item) raw score
Notes: Scored as sum of 6 items; blank if any items are missing

ElementDescription: PROMS - Physical Functioning (6-item) T-score
Notes: T-score based on raw score and published conversion table. The T-score rescales the raw score into a standardized T-score with a mean of 50 and a standard deviation of 10

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance (6 item; continuous) raw score
Notes: Scored as sum of 6 items; blank if any items are missing

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance (6 item; continuous) T-score
Notes: T-score based on raw score and published conversion table. The T-score rescales the raw score into a standardized T-score with a mean of 50 and a standard deviation of 10

ElementDescription: How helpful have the pain management materials or services you received in the RESOLVE study been for you?
Notes: 1 = Very helpful; 2 = Somewhat helpful; 3 = Neither helpful nor unhelpful; 4 = Somewhat unhelpful; 5 = Very unhelpful

ElementDescription: How satisfied have you been with the pain management materials or services you received from the RESOLVE study?
Notes: 1 = Very satisfied; 2 = Somewhat satisfied; 3 = Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied; 4 = Somewhat dissatisfied; 5 = Very dissatisfied

ElementDescription: How supported have you felt in managing your pain by the materials or services you received from the RESOLVE study?
Notes: 1 = Very supported; 2 = Somewhat supported; 3 = Neither supported nor unsupported; 4 = Somewhat unsupported; 5 = Very unsupported

ElementDescription: How satisfied have you been with the support you received from the RESOLVE study materials or services?
Notes: 1 = Very satisfied; 2 = Somewhat satisfied; 3 = Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied; 4 = Somewhat dissatisfied; 5 = Very dissatisfied

ElementDescription: Mobility
Notes: 1= I have no problems walking; 2= I have slight problems walking; 3= I have moderate problems walking; 4= I have severe problems walking; 5= I am unable to walk

ElementDescription: Self-Care
Notes: 1= I have no problems washing or dressing myself; 2= I have slight problems washing or dressing myself; 3= I have moderate problems washing or dressing myself; 4= I have severe problems washing or dressing myself; 5= I am unable to wash or dress myself

ElementDescription: Usual Activities
Notes: 1= I have no problems doing my usual activities; 2= I have slight problems doing my usual activities; 3= I have moderate problems doing my usual activities; 4= I have severe problems doing my usual activities; 5= I am unable to do my usual activities

ElementDescription: Pain/Discomfort
Notes: 1= I have no pain or discomfort; 2= I have slight pain or discomfort; 3= I have moderate pain or discomfort; 4= I have severe pain or discomfort; 5= I have extreme pain or discomfort

ElementDescription: Anxiety/Depression
Notes: 1= I am not anxious or depressed; 2= I am slightly anxious or depressed; 3= I am moderately anxious or depressed; 4= I am severely anxious or depressed; 5= I am extremely anxious or depressed

ElementDescription: Your Health Today
PGIC Overall Pain (Since the start of the study, would you say that your overall pain is much better, moderately better, a little better, no change, a little worse, moderately worse, much worse)
Notes: 0 = Much better; 1 = Moderately better; 2 = A little better; 3 = No change; 4 = A little worse; 5 = Moderately worse; 6 = Much worse

ElementDescription: PGIC Overall Well-Being (Since the start of the study, would you say that your overall well-being is much better, moderately better, a little better, no change, a little worse, moderately worse, much worse)
Notes: 0 = Much better; 1 = Moderately better; 2 = A little better; 3 = No change; 4 = A little worse; 5 = Moderately worse; 6 = Much worse

ElementDescription: Score on 3-Item PEG (pain, enjoyment, general activity) scale
Notes: Scored as sum of 3 items; blank if any item is missing

ElementDescription: Graded Chronic Pain Scale Revised (GCPS-R) score
Notes: 0 = Grade 0: No Chronic Pain (both pain frequency and pain limits life items are ''Never'' or ''Some days''); 1 = Grade 1: Mild Chronic Pain (pain frequency item is ''Most days'' or ''Every day'', pain limits life item is ''Never'' or ''Some days'' and peg score item is less than 12); 2 = Grade 2: Bothersome Chronic Pain (pain frequency item is ''Most days'' or ''Every day'', pain limits life item is ''Never'' or ''Some days'' and peg score item is at least 12); 3 = Grade 3: High Impact Chronic Pain (both pain frequency and pain limits life items are ''Most days'' or ''Every day'')

ElementDescription: Positive screen for TAPS-1 (Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medication and other Substances)
Notes: 0 = No (all of the four items for that gender are ''Never''); 1 = Yes (any response other than ''Never'' on any of the items); missing if all four questions for that gender are missing or are a mix of missing and ''Never''

ElementDescription: Concomitant one-on-one or group counseling for pain
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Concomitant mental health or emotional wellness app
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Concomitant pain management app
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Concomitant pain management educational program
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Marijuana/cannabis use in the past 3 months
Notes: 0 = Daily or almost daily; 1 = Weekly; 2 = Monthly; 3 = Less than monthly; 4 = Never

ElementDescription: Used marijuana/cannabis in the past 3 months to manage pain
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Used marijuana/cannabis in the past 3 months to manage other symptoms
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Used marijuana/cannabis in the past 3 months for non-medical reasons
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Description of other symptoms that marijuana/cannabis was used to manage
Use of marijuana/cannabis in past 3 months compared to before joining the RESOLVE study
Notes: 1 = Less Often; 2 = The Same; 3 = More often

ElementDescription: Did NOT use prescription medication just for the feeling, more than prescribed or that were not prescribed for them in the past 3 months
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Used opioid pain relievers (for example, OxyContin, Vicodin, Percocet, Methadone) just for the feeling, more than prescribed or that were not prescribed for them in the past 3 months
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Used medications for anxiety or sleeping (for example, Xanax, Ativan, Klonopin) just for the feeling, more than prescribed or that were not prescribed for them in the past 3 months
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Participant used medications for ADHD (for example, Adderall or Ritalin) just for the feeling, more than prescribed or that were not prescribed for them in the past 3 months
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Participant used other prescription medications just for the feeling, more than prescribed or that were not prescribed for them in the past 3 months
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Description of other prescription medications used just for the feeling, more than prescribed or that were not prescribed for them in the past 3 months
Use of prescription medications in past 3 months compared to before joining the RESOLVE study
Notes: 1 = Less Often; 2 = The Same; 3 = More often

ElementDescription: Use of illicit drugs including cocaine or crack, heroin, methamphetamine (crystal meth), hallucinogens, ecstasy/MDMA in past 3 months
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Use of illicit drugs in past 3 months compared to before joining the RESOLVE study
Notes: 1 = Less Often; 2 = The Same; 3 = More often

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Interference Item 2): Number best describes how pain interfered with MOOD during past 7 days
Notes: 0 = Does not Interfere; 10 = Completely Interferes

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Interference Item 3): Number best describes how pain interfered with WALKING ABILITY during past 7 days
Notes: 0 = Does not Interfere; 10 = Completely Interferes

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Interference Item 4): Number best describes how pain interfered with NORMAL WORK during past 7 days
Notes: 0 = Does not Interfere; 10 = Completely Interferes

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Interference Item 5): Number best describes how pain interfered with RELATIONS WITH OTHER PEOPLE during past 7 days
Notes: 0 = Does not Interfere; 10 = Completely Interferes

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Interference Item 6): Number best describes how pain interfered with SLEEP during past 7 days
Notes: 0 = Does not Interfere; 10 = Completely Interferes

ElementDescription: BP-SF (Pain Interference Item 7): Number best describes how pain interfered with ENJOYMENT OF LIFE during past 7 days
Notes: 0 = Does not Interfere; 10 = Completely Interferes

ElementDescription: SDOH - In the past 12 months, was there a time when you were not able to pay the mortgage or rent on time?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: SDOH - In the past 12 months, was there a time when you did not have a steady place to sleep or slept in a shelter?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: SDOH - In the past 12 months, how many places have you lived?
SDOH - Within the past 12 months, we were worried whether our food would run out before we got money to buy more.
Notes: 0 = Never true; 1 = Sometimes true; 2 = Often true

ElementDescription: SDOH - Within the past 12 months, the food we bought just didn't last, and we didn''t have money to get more.
Notes: 0 = Never true; 1 = Sometimes true; 2 = Often true

ElementDescription: SDOH - How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics like food, housing, medical care, and heating?
Notes: 0 = Not hard at all; 1 = Not very hard; 2 = Somewhat hard; 3 = Hard; 4 = Very Hard

ElementDescription: SDOH - Has a lack of transportation kept you from medical appointments or from getting medications?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: SDOH - Has a lack of transportation kept you from meetings, work, or from getting things needed for daily living?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Short Form 6-Item (PCS-SF) score
Notes: Scored as sum of 6 items; utilize mean imputation for missing items to obtain sum score if at least 4 items answered; blank otherwise

ElementDescription: PSE 5-Item (Item 1) How certain are you that you can decrease your pain quite a bit?
Notes: 10 = Very Uncertain; 100 = Very Certain

ElementDescription: PSE 5-Item (Item 2) How certain are you that you can continue most of your daily activities?
Notes: 10 = Very Uncertain; 100 = Very Certain

ElementDescription: PSE 5-Item (Item 3) How certain are you that you can keep your pain from interfering with your sleep?
Notes: 10 = Very Uncertain; 100 = Very Certain

ElementDescription: PSE 5-Item (Item 4) How certain are you that you can make a small-to-moderate reduction in your pain by using methods other than taking extra medications?
Notes: 10 = Very Uncertain; 100 = Very Certain

ElementDescription: PSE 5-Item (Item 5) How certain are you that you can make a large reduction in your pain by using methods other than taking extra medications?
Notes: 10 = Very Uncertain; 100 = Very Certain

ElementDescription: Employment status (What is your current employment status?)
Notes: 1 = Full-time employment; 2 = Not employed; 3 = Part-time employment

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 1): Are you able to do chores such as vacuuming or yard work?
Notes: 1 = Unable to do; 2 = With much difficulty; 3 = With some difficulty; 4 = With a little difficulty; 5 = Without any difficulty

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 2): Are you able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace?
Notes: 1 = Unable to do; 2 = With much difficulty; 3 = With some difficulty; 4 = With a little difficulty; 5 = Without any difficulty

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 3): Are you able to go for a walk of at least 15 minutes?
Notes: 1 = Unable to do; 2 = With much difficulty; 3 = With some difficulty; 4 = With a little difficulty; 5 = Without any difficulty

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 4): Are you able to run errands and shop?
Notes: 1 = Unable to do; 2 = With much difficulty; 3 = With some difficulty; 4 = With a little difficulty; 5 = Without any difficulty

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 5): Does your health limit you in doing two hours of physical labor?
Notes: 1 = Cannot do; 2 = Quite a lot; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Very little; 5 = Not at all; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: PROMIS Physical Functioning (Item 6): Does your health now limit you in doing moderate work around the house?
Notes: 1 = Cannot do; 2 = Quite a lot; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Very little; 5 = Not at all; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 1): Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 2): Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 3): Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 4): Feeling tired or having little energy
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Disability benefits for pain (Have you ever applied for, or received, disability insurance for your pain condition?)
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 5): Poor appetite or overeating
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 6): Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 7): Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading or watching TV
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: PHQ-8 (Item 8): Moving or speaking slowly or being fidgety or restless
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-8) self-reported depression score
Notes: Scored as sum of 8 items; utilized mean imputation for missing items to obtain sum score if at least 4 items answered; blank otherwise

ElementDescription: GAD-7 (Item 1): Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: GAD-7 (Item 2): Not being able to stop or control worrying
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: GAD-7 (Item 3): Worrying too much about different things
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: GAD-7 (Item 4): Trouble relaxing
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: GAD-7 (Item 5): Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Intensity Item 1): Number best describes pain at its WORST in the past 7 days
Notes: 0 = No pain; 10 = Pain as bad as you can imagine

ElementDescription: GAD-7 (Item 6): Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: GAD-7 (Item 7): Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Several days; 2 = More than half the days; 3 = Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety Disorder scale (GAD-7) self-reported anxiety
Notes: Scored as sum of 7 items; utilized mean imputation for missing items to obtain sum score if at least 4 items answered; blank otherwise

ElementDescription: During the past month, how many hours and minutes of actual sleep did you get at night? (HOURS)
During the past month, how many hours and minutes of actual sleep did you get at night? (MINUTES)
Average duration of sleep per night during the past month (minutes)
Notes: Converted hours of sleep to minutes by multiplying by 60 and then added to reported minutes to get total duration of sleep in minutes; blank if both hours and minutes of sleep are missing

ElementDescription: Sleep duration categories Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) Item 4 score
Notes: 0 = At least 7 hours; 1 = At least 6 hours and less than 7 hours; 2 = At least 5 hours and less than 6 hours; 3 = Less than 5 hours

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance-SF 6a (Item 1): Sleep Quality
Notes: 1 = Very good; 2 = Good; 3 = Fair; 4 = Poor; 5 = Very poor

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance-SF 6a (Item 2): Sleep was Refreshing
Notes: 1 = Very much; 2 = Quite a bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = A little bit; 5 = Not at all

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance-SF 6a (Item 3): I had a problem with my sleep
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Quite a bit; 5 = Very much

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Intensity Item 2): Number best describes pain at its LEAST in the past 7 days
Notes: 0 = No pain; 10 = Pain as bad as you can imagine

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance-SF 6a (Item 4): I had difficulty falling asleep
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Quite a bit; 5 = Very much

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance-SF 6a (Item 5): My sleep was restless
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Quite a bit; 5 = Very much

ElementDescription: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance-SF 6a (Item 6): I tried hard to get to sleep
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = Quite a bit; 5 = Very much

ElementDescription: TAPS Tobacco Use (Item 1): In the past 12 months, how often have you used any tobacco product?
Notes: 0 = Daily or Almost Daily; 1 = Weekly; 2 = Monthly; 3 = Less Than Monthly; 4 = Never

ElementDescription: TAPS Alcohol Use Males (Item 2): In the past 12 months, how often have you had 5 or more drinks containing alcohol in one day?
Notes: 0 = Daily or Almost Daily; 1 = Weekly; 2 = Monthly; 3 = Less Than Monthly; 4 = Never

ElementDescription: TAPS Alcohol Use Females (Item 2): In the past 12 months, how often have you had 4 or more drinks containing alcohol in one day?
Notes: 0 = Daily or Almost Daily; 1 = Weekly; 2 = Monthly; 3 = Less Than Monthly; 4 = Never; 9999 = Refused

ElementDescription: TAPS Illicit Drug Use (Item 3): In the past 12 months, how often have you used any drugs including marijuana, cocaine or crack, heroin, methamphetamine (crystal meth), hallucinogens, ecstasy/MDMA?
Notes: 0 = Daily or Almost Daily; 1 = Weekly; 2 = Monthly; 3 = Less Than Monthly; 4 = Never

ElementDescription: TAPS Prescription Drug Use (Item 4): In the past 12 months, how often have you used any prescription medications just for the feeling, more than prescribed or that were not prescribed for you?
Notes: 0 = Daily or Almost Daily; 1 = Weekly; 2 = Monthly; 3 = Less Than Monthly; 4 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, how often did you have pain?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Some days; 2 = Most days; 3 = Every day

ElementDescription: Over the past 3 months, how often did pain limit your life or work activities?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Some days; 2 = Most days; 3 = Every day

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Intensity Item 3): Number best describes pain ON AVERAGE in the past 7 days
Notes: 0 = No pain; 10 = Pain as bad as you can imagine

ElementDescription: Are you not working or unable to work due to pain or a pain condition?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: High Impact Chronic Pain (Yes/No)
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes (both items are ''Most days'' or ''Every day''); blank if any item is missing

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Intensity Item 4): Number best describes your pain right now
Notes: 0 = No pain; 10 = Pain as bad as you can imagine

ElementDescription: BPI-SF (Pain Interference Item 1): Number best describes how pain interfered with GENERAL ACTIVITY during past 7 days
Notes: 0 = Does not Interfere; 10 = Completely Interferes
